original_definition: 'production unit' means a facility for generation of electricity made up of a single generation unit or of an aggregation of generation units;
generated_definition: 'production unit' means a production unit is a facility or group of facilities that produce electricity through the use of a specific technology or combination of technologies. the capacity of a production unit is determined by the maximum amount of electricity it can generate in a given period of time.

Article 2: ‘production unit’ means a facility for generation of electricity made up of a single generation unit or of an aggregation of generation units;
Article 4: Contracts for the physical delivery of electricity produced by a single production unit with a capacity equal to or less than 10 MW or by production units with a combined capacity equal to or less than 10 MW,
